instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.
definitions.A1989: What is A1989? A1989 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2018, 2019 with EMC 3124, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00850..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Topcase replaced with a new one, new accu bad?
threads.message:
Hi everyone,

I got a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> from client with not working keyboard (key b and n sometimes double printing the letter)

I ordered 3 new topcases including battery

After installing mainboard and display I have now that

[ATTACH alt="Click image for larger version  Name:	20191126_140033.jpg Views:	0 Size:	261.3 KB ID:	54825" type="full" width="30%"]54825._xfImport[/ATTACH]

I tryed with all 3, all the same. With the old one with keyboardp roblems accu is everything ok

is there any hint? PRAM reset already done.

I measured on the 2 pads from the accu under the large screw, on the old topcase with bad keyboard i get 2.2V on the new topcases 0V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Topcase replaced with a new one, new accu bad?
threads.message: is there any hint to activate the accu?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Topcase replaced with a new one, new accu bad?
threads.message:
Is that <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board?
Be sure <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> is 0V when you connect the battery.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Topcase replaced with a new one, new accu bad?
threads.message:
yes a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> is 0V when connect battery

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Topcase replaced with a new one, new accu bad?
threads.message:
After I turned off the AutoBoot with terminal its now not possible to boot in to the osx only by plugin the power adapter, only shows a big empty battery on display and then it shows on the adapter 20,4V 0.01 A

After new plug in same procedure.

by pressing the power button it is booting into the osx, but showing bad battery no charging.

After turn on autoboot its possible to boot into osx by plugin in the power adapter. but shows bad battery in every case

I have only a power adapter from a 2018 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> my be that is the problem?

[ATTACH alt="Click image for larger version  Name:	20191126_153401.jpg Views:	0 Size:	985.5 KB ID:	54832" type="full" width="30%"]54832._xfImport[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Topcase replaced with a new one, new accu bad?
threads.message: is it needful by replacing a new topcase with battery to activate something that the battery is charging ?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Topcase replaced with a new one, new accu bad?
threads.message: Did you try 87W charger for sure?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Topcase replaced with a new one, new accu bad?
threads.message:
no, in this moment i dont have one.
but i have another <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> same mainboard itis repaired already. Now I tryed the charger wich I posted a picture  with this good <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
that is charging well. It consumes about 2,7A
the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with the bad battery consumes maximum during booting 1,07A later less.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Topcase replaced with a new one, new accu bad?
threads.message:
Dukefawks mentioned to had the some problem, caused by bad battery.
Disconnected it and took the machine to Apple for the keyboard problem.
It should still be under warranty...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Topcase replaced with a new one, new accu bad?
threads.message:
I replaced the battery with another one and all is ok. All 3 Topcases had blocked Batterys.

[SOLVED]

Thanks for helping.
